Posts.Content: I'm 52 and have been having mammograms since I was 37 due to my mother having breast cancer. Just had my last one 3 weeks ago and as usual it came back clear. For the last 4-5 months my right breast has felt uncomfortable. Not sure how to describe it as it's not a throbbing pain and only comes and goes. I have really large dense breasts with lots of lumps and bumps so I'm never even sure if I felt a cancerous lump if I would even know what it was. If the mammo was clear should I just write the pain off as part of menopause? It just bothers me because I only feel it in one breast.
Posts.Title: Mammogram was clear

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. I am wondering if it is hormonal as I just stopped my periods about 7 months ago. I very rarely drink caffeine. No coffee no tea. Maybe 1 soda a month. I'll talk to my doctor about it soon. It's bothering enough that I just feel I need to have it checked even if it is only to put my mind at ease.
Posts.Title: Mammogram was clear

Posts.Content: On Aug 18, 2015 10:05 AM Nursie75495 wrote: My mammogram was 3D and showed one tumor, but the breast MRI turned up three more.  There is also something called PEM (proton emission mammography, like a PET scan for breasts) which is better for dense breasts.  That your mother had breast cancer (do you know if she had any of the gene mutations?) and you only feel this in one breast SHOULD bother you.  Get it followed up on.  If need help finding providers, holler at me.  Good luck-- Thanks for your response. I would feel better with some type of ultrasound or MRI. I have an appt scheduled in Sept with my doctor. He's pretty good about ordering tests if I have a concern. I have not heard of the PEM but it sounds like what I need. My mothers cancer was estrogen fed. I'm not sure what that means?!?! I hope you are doing well. :)
Posts.Title: Mammogram was clear

Posts.Content: Thanks for your response. I would feel better with some type of ultrasound or MRI. I have an appt scheduled in Sept with my doctor. He's pretty good about ordering tests if I have a concern. I have not heard of the PEM but it sounds like what I need. My mothers cancer was estrogen fed. I'm not sure what that means?!?! I hope you are doing well. :)
